intro: Muellera variabilis, commonly known as the variable muellera, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. It often grows in humid, shaded environments, such as under forest canopies. The leaves are usually opposite and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface, contributing to its adaptability in various ecological niches.
